## Get available LLMs
```{r}

# Read the CSV file into a data frame and remove duplicates
models <- read_csv("private/llms_v2.csv") %>%
  distinct(provider, model)

# Initialize a vector to store the 'has_data' values
has_data_flags <- logical(nrow(models))

# Iterate over each row in the models data frame
for (i in 1:nrow(models)) {
  provider <- models$provider[i]
  model <- models$model[i]
  
  # Create the path
  path <- paste0("llm_data/", provider, "/", model)
  
  # Check if the path exists and set the 'has_data' flag accordingly
  has_data_flags[i] <- file.exists(path)
}

# Add the 'has_data' column to the models data frame
models <- models %>%
  mutate(has_data = has_data_flags)

```



## Generate LLM data

```{r}
# py_run_file("py/test.py")

```

# Read LLM data

```{r}

considerations <- read_csv("llm_data/1.Uppsala Speaks_considerations.csv")
considerations <- considerations %>% select(-c(1:4))

long_data <- pivot_longer(considerations, cols = everything(), names_to = "Consideration", values_to = "Value")


# Create a box plot using ggplot2
ggplot(long_data, aes(x = Consideration, y = Value, fill = Consideration)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Box Plot of Considerations",
       x = "Consideration",
       y = "Value") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")  # Remove legend since x-axis labels suffice

```

```{r}
policies <- read_csv("llm_data/1.Uppsala Speaks_policies.csv")
policies <- policies %>% select(-c(1:4))

long_data <- pivot_longer(policies, cols = everything(), names_to = "Policy", values_to = "Value")


# Create a box plot using ggplot2
ggplot(long_data, aes(x = Policy, y = Value, fill = Policy)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Box Plot of Policies",
       x = "Policy",
       y = "Value") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")  # Remove legend since x-axis labels suffice

```


## Calculate Cronbach's Alpha
```{r echo=FALSE}
res_c <- alpha(considerations, check.keys = TRUE)
res_p <- alpha(policies, check.keys = TRUE)
```

```{r}
# Print the result
print(res_c$total$raw_alpha)
print(res_p$total$raw_alpha)
```
